Old but golden. One of the most impressive games i've ever played.

I don't hear this one spoken about half as much as any other game in the series, which is a massive shame because in my own opinion this is the half life game with the most personality. Every portion of every room has a purpose, the combat is clean and concise and the enemies are memorable and easy to follow when trying to take mental note of what each enemy is capable of. Age has slowed it down a bit, it looks like s**t and it has the occasional "early 3D game design slog" parts that you'll see in a lot of 90's games, but still one of my favourite games.

이 그래픽으로도 거부감없는 흡입력을 보여주었다

Don't get me wrong, this game is really, really fun, but there's quite a list of things wrong with it. Imagine a game with fall damage, now times the fall damage taken from falling by 10, then times it by 69420 and you'll get about the fall damage you have in half life. Oh? You barely fell off a ledge? Time to remove 75% of your health! It's incredibly difficult in lots of situations, even on medium mode. It autosaves at some really bad times, and sometimes you might even get stuck in an infinite loop of reloading and dying (although uncommon it isn't unheard of). I would've been able to brush past all that and my review would've been a yes but the final nail on the coffin is how bloody hard it is to figure out what it wants you to do, you have to go through all these different possible solutions to finally get a result that moves you onto the next stage for the cycle to repeat. 4/10

So I have a love hate relationship with this game. RNG is great cause it makes me feel like I'm apart of the world rather than the world revolves around me. There are time's I die thanks to something out of my control and that only happened a quarter of my time playing the game. My main complaint is the loading times where you think it will auto save but in fact you have to carry on a bit more in order for the auto save to be placed. A lot of my fears was in reality in this world and thank god it was at low poly cause I would've quit 5 minutes in if I was playing it in high poly or in fact VR. (I refuse to play Half Life Alex, except for the G-Man cutscenes.) It sucks that this was a port of the console version which explains the different machine gun but other than that and the save points, this is a fantastic game and I can finally play Gmod without Missing textures. (Well mainly for the textures connected to Half-Life 1.)

Uno de los mejores juegos de su época, un juego muy bien logrado y bastante entretenido para los años que tiene, la historia de Gordon Freeman es una de las mejores que hay, la campaña es larguísima y muy entretenida como para dar muchísimas horas de juego. Todos los enemigos, amigos y misiones son muy memorables, un juego que vale muchísimo la pena comprar y jugar.
